evs.metric.metrics
Interface SkillScore

All Known Implementing Classes:
BrierSkillScore, MeanContRankProbSkillScore, ROCScore
public interface SkillScore

An interface that identifies a skill metric. A skill metric should override the conventional metric of the same type and implement this interface. The skill score is computed by overriding the compute() method in the Metric class, calling the super type first and then checking to establish if results are available for reference forecasts. If results are available, the skill score is computed for each reference forecast and added to the result store. ONLY ONE REFERENCE FORECAST CAN BE USED AT PRESENT. IN ORDER TO SUPPORT MULTIPLE REFERENCE FORECASTS, ADDITIONAL REFERENCE FORECAST IDENTIFIERS MUST BE DEFINED FOR STORING THESE RESULTS IN THE RESULT MAP. Note that results for a skill metric only become available once the results for two forecasting systems are available (i.e. the compute() method has successfully stored results (for a reference forecast) on at least one prior occasion).

Author:
evs@hydrosolved.com

Method Summary
 java.lang.String getBaseMetricName()
          Returns the name of the base metric for which the skill calculation is computed.
 ReferenceForecastParameter getDefaultRefFcst()
          Returns any default reference forecast implemented for the skill score, such as sample climatology.
 ReferenceForecastParameter getRefFcst()
          Returns a reference forecast parameter.
 boolean hasDefaultRefFcst()
          Returns true if the skill score has a default reference forecast.
